revised_title: Determination of Silica's Formula and Its Relation to Other Substances
tldr: The author, Philip Yorke, investigates the formula of silica and its relationship to other substances. Through a series of experiments, he determines the equivalent of silicic acid using various carbonates and hydrates. He also synthesizes sodium silicate and discusses the possibility of multiple equivalents for silicic acid based on the presence of water and the nature of the base.
